alert.note: Alert for Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:20PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Reno, Sedgwick and Kingman Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 819 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms over the area, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Goddard, Maize, Kingman, Cheney, Sedgwick, Colwich, Garden Plain, Mount Hope, Downtown Wichita, Kechi, Andale, Bentley, Nashville, West Wichita, Eisenhower National Airport and Northeast Wichita. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 8 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Kansas.
